All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseDownHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseMoveHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseOutHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseOverHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseUpHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseWheelHandler, com.google.gwt.event.shared.EventHandler
public class MouseManager
extends InputManager<com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasAllMouseHandlers>
implements com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseDownHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseMoveHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseOutHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseOverHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseUpHandler, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.MouseWheelHandler

Manages the state of the mouse on an object.

Author:
hao1300@gmail.com

Method Detail

manage

public void manage(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasAllMouseHandlers obj)
Description copied from class: InputManager
Let this InputManager manages the given object's input state. A InputManager can only manages one object at a time. To manage a different object, call InputManager.unmanage() first.

Specified by:
manage in class InputManager<com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasAllMouseHandlers>

unmanage

public void unmanage()
Description copied from class: InputManager
Unmanages the managed object. If no object is being managed, then calling this should have no effect.

Specified by:
unmanage in class InputManager<com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasAllMouseHandlers>

isButtonDown

public boolean isButtonDown(int button)
Returns true if the given mouse button is down. The mouse buttons are NativeEvent.BUTTON_LEFT, NativeEvent.BUTTON_RIGHT, NativeEvent.BUTTON_MIDDLE

Parameters:
button -
